intro: Hieracium gothicograellsianum ides, commonly known as the Gothic Graellsian Hawkweed, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to specific regions in Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils, often in mountainous or alpine environments. Its flowers are yellow, with a strikingly intricate structure that aids in pollination by insects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
